snippet: Right-wing politicians joined a rally of thousands in Islamabad led by the militant Hafiz Muhammad Saeed.
abstract: Prominent jihadis and right-wing politicians, angered by the reopening of NATO supply lines through Pakistan, mount determined show of force in Islamabad; Hafiz Muhammad Saeed, founder of militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba, addresses thousands of flag-waving supporters.

byline.contributor: Waqar Gilani contributed reporting from Jhelum, Pakistan, and Salman Masood from Islamabad.

lead_paragraph: Right-wing politicians joined a rally of thousands in Islamabad led by the militant Hafiz Muhammad Saeed.

headline.seo: Jihadis in Pakistan Protest Supply Route Reopenings
headline.main: Pakistan Militant Leads Rally Against Supply Route Reopenings
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Militant Leads Rally Against Supply Route Reopenings
